pages.text: Here, I'll tell ya about all 9 of the gems in this book! There's the Ruby, Sapphire, Amethyst, Garnet, Jade, Jasper, Spinel, Topaz, and Agate. To

pages.title: Ruby
pages.text: This is the Ruby. This simple lookin gem w/ a texture unchanged from the original beta design by Mojang, edited to be multi-color by Chaos for some dumbass reason, can turn any zombie villager back into a villager within a 50 block radius! Powerful sucker, aint it?

pages.title: Sapphire
pages.text: A Sapphire. It's abilities are a bit unknown to me, but it seems to have something to do with Impending...wutever that means

pages.title: Amethyst
pages.text: Ah, the Amethyst. Truthy the most useful of them all. And quite a bit different to use. More info in the dimensions tab

pages.title: Garnet
pages.text: This gem's pretty handy. When this one's used, projectiles that fly by you will be noped! No more pesky Scooby-Skeletons!

pages.title: Jade
pages.text: This one isnt quite as OP as the Ruby, but it does a neat trick. Within a small radius, crops will instantly grow to full size while in use!

pages.title: Jasper
pages.text: The Jasper seemingly makes Lucky Mobs weaker so they put up less of a fight when you try to farm lukcy blocks.

pages.title: Spinel
pages.text: Works better if you have a Topaz with you as well. When placed in an item frame above a spawner, it overclocks it, meaning things will spawn like CRAZY!

pages.title: Topaz
pages.text: Doesn't do much on it's own. This handy gem resets any spawner overclocking any Spinels caused. Does not reverse the effects of a Corrupted Ink Sac though...

pages.title: Agate
pages.text: Need more eggs? This gem is for you! Place this in a frame and any nearby chickens will lay eggs like there's no tomorrow! Good God, that's a LOT of omlets!
